property.description:
Webservice Transactions Per Second

This reports displays various web based transactions per second.

Top-N Reports.

  • The task of retrieving the top N rows from APG database (by interface utilization, file system utilization, etc.) is often referred to as a "Top-N Reports."

Top-N / Processor Utilization.

When a device has more than one CPU, all CPU usages are averaged in order to get an estimation of the real device load.

Top-N Reports.

  • The task of retrieving the top N rows from APG database (by interface utilization, file system utilization, etc.) is often referred to as a "Top-N Reports."

High File System Usage.

The following file systems are excluded from this report:

  • /dev/*
  • /devices/*
  • /proc/*
  • /devices/*
  • /vol/*
  • /sys/*
  • /system/*
  • /etc/mnttab

Top-N / Processor Utilization.

When a device has more than one CPU, all CPU usages are averaged in order to get an estimation of the real device load.

This report displays device reachability.

Reachability is defined as the ability of the poller to communicate with the device. To be considered as reachable, a device must respond to ICMP pings or SNMP requests (depending on the collector).

Reachability is generally not known by the poller until the device is successfully polled once, so an immediate value is not always obtainable on each poll. The only device types presented in this report are those with unreachable devices.
